holidays.name: International Sorry Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to acknowledging and apologizing for the mistreatment of Indigenous peoples, particularly in Australia, fostering reconciliation and awareness.
holidays.origin: Started in Australia in 1998 to commemorate the anniversary of the 1997 Bringing Them Home report that investigated the forced removal of Aboriginal children.
holidays.funFact: The day helps to keep alive the conversations about Indigenous rights and historical injustices, encouraging healing across communities.
